title: Who will win the 2021 presidential election in Chile?
possible_answers: There will not be a presidential election in Chile before 1 January 2022
preds: Too close for me. On one hand, Twitter and Google Trends statistics shows Boric with a slight lead. However, actual and likely voters seem to favor Kast more than the markets or social media.

The hard left vote is capped and 53.94% of the votes in the first electoral round went to parties that are not considered leftists (anything right of the social democrats of the old Conertacion). Of the votes that Provoste got, 80% might go to Boric, but 20% of the left-center DC won't. We can split that 10% won't vote, 10% for Kast. Sichel's Vote, 80% will go for Kast, 0% Boric, 20% won't vote. Artes votes will be 95% Boric and 5% most likelt won't vote (extremely hard left). of MEO, 90% for Boric and 10% won't vote. Parisi, 70% Kast, 10% Boric and 20% won't vote. In that calculation, 51.9% will go for Kast and 48.1% for Boric. I have 60% confidence in that result.
If 90% of Provoste votes goes to Boric (10% DC just won't vote) and 100% of the hard left, Kast gets 50.3% and Boric 49.7%. That would be 10% probablity
The threshold is Parisi. if the vote thas goes to vote is split 90% Kast 10% Boric (the love of the hard left in those voters is much less powerfull than the fear of the hard left, and Parisi has a Mesianic attitude which his voters will follow and he destroyed Boric economic program in his show). So, any situation where more than 30% of Parisi voteers don't vote, that takes us to a Boric win. This is a true probability of ocurrence, which is 30%.
in those scenarios, 70% indicate Kast wins and 30% Boric wins The other Wildcard are the new votes. In the Piñera-Guiller election, 6.7mm people voted on first round and 7mm in second round. 300k different. 
In the Referndum, 7.6mm people voted.
I'll add 500k to get to 100k of the referendum votes, a total of 7.5mm.
The split here is if Boric gets +52% of that new vote, then it's his election. But normally people who don't vote in the first round are less passionate of politics and not follow a hard party, where Kast presents a show of more stability. Boric would have to win a significant amount of those votes to end up as the president elect. Thus, I give a 70% chance of Kast winning by a very slim margin, 51% of votes for Kast to 49% of votes for Boric

https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/chile-election-poll-shows-race-tightening-polarized-showdown-nears-2021-12-14/
I really hate close elections, especially if I have to care about the outcomes. . . .

Boric' opponent Kast seems to be under pressure after the NSDAP membership of his father (which Kast was denying) was apparently confirmed. 
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/dec/08/chile-jose-antonio-kast-father-nazi-party
This may make it more difficult for Kast to portray Boric as "radical". Polls are pretty close though, and I haven’t seen any carried out after Dec. 4.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2021_Chilean_presidential_election#Second_round

Adjustment to latest polling with Boric leading H2H 47% - 34%. I don't want to get too excited, polling has shown itself to be a very poor indicator of election results over the last couple years.  1. https://www.cnnchile.com/elecciones2021/boric-se-impone-encuesta-data-influye-segunda-vuelta_20211201/
Some good polls for Boric, FWTW: https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/leftist-chile-presidential-candidate-leads-new-poll-dec-19-vote-looms-2021-11-29/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2021_Chilean_presidential_election#Second_round Three new polls came in, some with a surprising advantage for Boric

Jose Antonio Kast. Chile realized common sense is much needed in order to overcome it's current difficulties. People are trusting less and less in politicians and Chile`s people has enough general culture to realize it has been lied by the leftist party

Getting a bit unpredictable here...
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2021_Chilean_presidential_election#Second_round
It's funny how these epic battles between a right wing populist and their contender often magically dance around 50:50 (e.g. in Austria 2016, which is pretty familiar to me:  If the populist's opponent reaches out to the middle and sucesfully counters negativ/dirty campaigning from the right, he/she wins)
Slight increase to Boric's chances per Provoste endorsement: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-23/chile-s-leftist-contender-adds-key-endorsement-ahead-of-runoff

Looking at this from an ideological perspective only, it looks like a real hair splitter With the right block (Christian Social Front, Chile Podemos Más, and Party of the People - wiki's assessment, 1) commanding the following (noting all percentages except for the presidential are not binary); - 53.5% of the presidential vote 
- 45.05% of the popular vote (by party)
- 73 out of 155 seats in the chamber of deputies; and 
- 23 out of 50 seats in the senate.  Repositioning forecast accordingly, between the raw numbers of the presidential vote and popular vote.  But, skewing towards ideological forces holding given (IMO) those holding a centrist position is more likely to vote to their extreme than the other, which gives Kast the edge. Also noting, I don't have any "feel of the vibe" in Chile, so can't comment if the results are going to energize or dissuade voters moving into the presidential run-off.  Can anyone provide some insight on that?  1. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2021_Chilean_general_election#Results

It seem that, Sichel have more money to spend or some people think it's worth spending money on him:
 peopletresquintos.cl/financiamiento/
Close to the current 'crowd' forecast for now. https://foreignpolicy.com/2021/11/16/chile-election-president-pinera-boric-kast/

Taking Kast more seriously after recent reports: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-06/chile-s-kast-beats-top-leftist-contenders-in-presidential-poll, https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/chile-conservative-kast-maintains-lead-final-pre-election-opinion-polls-2021-11-06/, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2021_Chilean_presidential_election

One current take is that Boric may still prevail if a runoff involving Kast is needed: https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/chile-right-wing-kast-gains-edge-polls-presidential-vote-nears-2021-11-01/ Also: https://www.reddit.com/r/asklatinamerica/comments/q0tz2q/chileans_how_high_are_the_chances_of_kast_going/

Update on latest polling (as summarized in wiki, 1) Boric is winning all head-to-heads, but is unlikely to win outright. 1. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2021_Chilean_presidential_election
Weighted blend of my intuitive forecast with prediction markets and current GJO median.
This forecast is a subjective judgement more than anything. Trying to test different theories and putting them on record.
Kast is the one who looks most like previous presidents. So I bump up for that reason but doubt there is enough time.

Sichel down significantly in some recent polls, Kast is up, Boric still leading: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-11/conservative-candidate-sustains-surge-ahead-of-chile-s-election,https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2021_Chilean_presidential_election

With purely an outsiders view on Chilean politics, the current polling suggests the "right-leaning", "conservative" parties are splitting the vote allowing Boric to maintain a healthy lead in the polls.  Splitting the vote along ideological lines would appear that Boric would win a head to head as well.  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2021_Chilean_presidential_election

Kast moving up past Sichel in some recent polls with Boric still leading overall. Also likely still many undecided voters..: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2021_Chilean_presidential_election

The opinion is that there will a second-round runoff and one of the candidates will be Boric. Sichel is the likely other candidate for the second but José Antonio Kast of the right-wing Partido Republicano (PR) is rising in the polls and could act as a spoiler to allow Provoste to face off Boric. https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/half-chileans-still-scratching-heads-over-november-presidential-pick-poll-shows-2021-09-15/  https://www.eiu.com/n/most-polarised-election-in-chile-since-1989/

Mix of averaging prediction markets and intuitive adjusting based on what I see online, for example @jgscofield's forecast here: https://www.gjopen.com/comments/1336587 However, my critique for my current forecast is that Boric doesn't seem like the past presidents of Chile. Sichel and Kast look closer to the average Chilean president.

I'm biased. My gut votes for Sichel. But I know nothing lol. There's just so many other people in contention (especially who just recently announced they are running). I thought Boric and Sichel are the only two options left but apparently not according to Wikipedia.
Check out page 17, looks like Sichel just barely eging out Boric, but with notable vote shares for other candidates: https://plazapublica.cl/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/Track-PP-395-Agosto-S1.pdf

Boric leads in some early opinion polls: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2021_Chilean_presidential_election https://www.predictit.org/markets/detail/7350/Who-will-be-elected-president-of-Chile-in-2021

This site looks like the main polling available, showing Boric with slight edge. Note that polling missed pretty significantly in the first round, so take for what it’s worth:  https://www.cadem.cl/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/Track-PP-393-Julio-S4.pdf

Adjusting forecast a bit mainly based upon recent poll numbers here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2021_Chilean_presidential_election  https://www.predictit.org/markets/detail/7350/Who-will-be-elected-president-of-Chile-in-2021

In the 2000s history shows a duopoly between a left wing and a right wing candidate, giving Boric a chance due to the current right wing president. Whether the popularity of Narvaez for PS will split the left wing vote is an interesting dilemma and new poling will show its salience. Sichel appears to be quite popular, but as the race goes into a head to head level, it will be interesting to see if it holds.

Provoste's announced candidacy may make this question a little more complicated. Her previous poll numbers weren't as strong as the top two but appeared to be in the upper tier of (primary) candidates: https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-23/center-left-candidate-jumps-into-chile-presidential-race, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Opinion_polling_for_the_2021_Chilean_presidential_election ..Will need to rely mainly upon Google search results to keep up with this question

My reading of the political situation is that the Chilean electorate is ready to upturn the establishment, reject the status quo and introduce a progressive administration.
Having said that, there appears to be a rejection of the extremes of the political spectrum.
Support for the right-wing coalition had fallen to 24% of the vote for President Sebastián Piñera in a recent election and the loss of many municipalities that had traditionally voted for the right and considered an indictment of the centre right who blocked progressive reforms.
Only 40% of the vote went to the establishment candidates and 60% to independents and/or newcomers.
There is a demand for a rewriting of Pinochet’s constitution, during his military rule, the dismissal of government backed candidates in these elections plus the election of two-thirds of the Independent and opposition candidates will enable a new constitution.
Pinera has stated that his government and the other traditional parties are attuned to the populace.
Boric would appear to be at the forefront of this progressive movement, while Sichel is an independent and considered a centrist but difficulty to position politically.
Of the other potential candidates José Antonio Kast is possibly too right wing and Yasna Provoste Campillay who is also centrist but may be considered part of the establishment given her long career in government. https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/may/18/a-new-chile-political-elite-rejected-in-vote-for-constitutional-assembly https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-57142087  https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2021/may/27/chile-political-establishment-change-elections  https://www.economist.com/the-americas/2021/05/27/an-electoral-surprise-in-chile-may-produce-a-left-wing-constitution  https://americasquarterly.org/article/meet-the-candidates-chile/  https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/jul/19/gabriel-boric-chile-president-election

This forecast is based on :
*Boric wins 1M voices last Sunday,
*His strong students supporters in streets.
*the Common Force movement gave its support to Boric, after he beat Marcelo Díaz in a plebiscite held on May 27-28. He is stroming towards presidency!
